clean_data: Information Security Analyst Information span lSecurityspan span lAnalystspan Information Security Analyst Abington Institute of Technology Stafford VA Seeking Cyber Security Analyst position in a growthoriented organization with focus on FISMA RMF NIST System Security Monitoring Risk Assessments Audit Engagements Testing Information Technology Controls and Developing Security Policies Procedures and Guidelines STANDARDS Security Assessment Authorization SAA OMB Circular A130 Appendix III NIST 800 series FIPS 199 FISMA FISCAM Information Security Continuous Monitoring ISCM Work Experience Information Security Analyst Abington Institute of Technology Abington PA December 2014 to Present Ensures implementation of appropriate security controls for Information System based on NIST Special Publication 80053 rev 4 FIPS 200 and System Categorization using NIST 80060 and FIPS 199 Initiates meeting to discuss vulnerabilities and potential remediation actions with system and application owners Ensures identified weaknesses from vulnerabilities scans are remediated in accordance with defined time frames Works on maximizing automation of security controls in the cloudbased environment Experience in developing test plan for assessment and documenting security controls across variety of systems Involves in security awareness program to educate employees and managers on current threat and vulnerabilities Involves in identifying security gaps and providing security recommendation to address gaps and complete risk profile Conducts security control assessment to assess the adequacy of management operational privacy and technical security controls implemented Develops Security Assessment Report SAR detailing the results of the assessment along with Plan of Action and Milestones POAM Conduct follow up meetings to assist information system owners to closeremediate POAM items Develops System Security Plans SSP to provide an overview of system security requirements and describes the controls in place or planned by information system owners to meet those requirements Conducts IT risk assessment to identify system threats vulnerabilities and risks Prepares recommendation reports that are made available to system owners to remediate identified vulnerabilities during the risk assessment process Works with system application team conducting interviews and collecting artifacts relevant to the assessment of security controls Generates as requested templates for providing highlevel FISMA compliance IT security OA or ATO briefings to the Authorizing Official Reviews all ISSO provided documentation for accuracy and relevancy provides followup to ISSOs to ensure documents are properly completed IT Security Analyst Innovative Technology Consulting Stafford VA June 2012 to November 2014 Assessed program and security controls using Organization IT Security Policy Handbook and NIST Special Publications to provide information necessary to determine their overall effectiveness Developed a security baseline controls and test plan that was used to assess implemented security controls Analyzed data related to security incidents and monitored compliance Conducted security control assessments to assess the adequacy of management operational privacy and technical security controls implemented Security Assessment Reports SAR were developed detailing the results of the assessment along with Plan of Action and Milestones POAM Responsible for auditing the security framework for existing and new enterprise technologies Ensured successful implementation and maintenance of defined security standards Responsible for information gathering analysis and incident response associated with enterprise technologies Requested and reviewed vulnerability scans Analyzed data related to security incidents and monitored compliance Program Director Elite Healthcare Service Woodbridge VA June 2010 to May 2012 Served as the program director managed and provided operational and fiscal oversight for the residential and supported living services Managed day to day operations for a residential and supported living for individuals with developmental and intellectual disabilities and managing over twenty staff members Responsible for the development planning and provision of therapeutic activities for the individuals both restorative and maintaining to meet the needs of the individuals enrolled in the program Developed core activity plans designed for maximal interest and learning potential including multisensory stimulation Prepared and oversaw all applicable licensing inspections ensured compliance within the regulation and guidelines developed and implemented plan of correction if necessary Trained staff and supervised personnel on procedural and programmatic matters including clinical field and oncall supervision Managed programs within budgetary guidelines notified supervisor of significant budgetary variances and addressed them by identifying causes and developed corrective plans of actions Approved expenditures and worked with executive director to stay within budgeted allocations Coordinated with state and local agencies to manage the delivery of services to consumers families and assure the quality of services while maintaining positive and consistent working relationships with all staff Participated in senior management meetings in the strategic planning efforts and made recommendations regarding planning and operational issues affecting the agency Oversaw administrative staff and functions including payroll billing and personnel for the entire agency Education Bachelor of Science degree in Business Management University of Maryland University College 2013 to 2019
